Fixed Income Instruments¶

The module is designed to support pricing and valuation of interest rate products such as bonds, discounted instruments and loans. It is named fixincome and can be imported in the following manner:

import faspy.interestrate.fixincome as fi

or:

from faspy.interestrate import fixincome as fi

There are several functions available in the module.

  • Date Construction

  • Coupon Structures

  • Valuations

Date Construction¶

The relevant function is date_structures() as defined below.

date_structures(bonds)¶

Generate dates for the coupon/interest periods

Parameters

bonds – a dictionary or an array of dictionaries with the following keys - “value_date”, “business_day”, “issue_date”, “value_date”, “maturity”, “frequency”, “day_count”, “date_generation”.

Return type

an array of dictionaries with the following keys - “start_date” and “end_date”.

Coupon Structures¶

There several coupon structures that can be generated by the library. However, these structures are generic i.e. these structures exclude variable coupon rate, variable margin (for floating rate bond), variable face value etc.

fixbond_structures(bonds)¶

Generate the coupon structure for a fixed rate bond

Parameters

bonds – a dictionary or an array of dictionaries with the following keys - ‘value_date, ‘business_day’, ‘issue_date’, ‘value_date’, ‘maturity’, ‘frequency’, ‘day_count’, ‘date_generation’, ‘ytm’, ‘face_value’, ‘coupon’.

Return type

An array of dictionary (or an array of it) with the following keys - ‘start_date’, ‘end_date’, ‘cpn_dcf’, ‘coupon’, ‘face_value’, ‘coupon_interest’, ‘fv_flow’, ‘cash_flow’, ‘ytm_dcf’, ‘period_df’, ‘accrued’, ‘df’, ‘pv’. If ‘ytm’ is ommitted or not valid, ‘ytm_dcf’, ‘period_df’, ‘accrued’, ‘df’, ‘pv’ keys will be ommited

Ommit ‘ytm’ key if you wish to customise the return object.

Valuations¶

Valuations are provided for several interest rate products namely fixed rate bonds, floating rate bonds, zero coupon bonds and discounted instruments.

fixbond_value(value_date, structures, yld, day_count,
frequency)

Revalue each cash flow of the structure.

Parameters

  • value_date – numpy.datetime64

  • structures – an array of dictionaries as returned by fixbond_structures(bonds).

  • yld – the yield (ytm or ytc) of the bond

  • day_count – str. day count convention used for the purpose of calculating interest

  • frequency – str. Frequency of coupon repayment

The function does not return anything as it modifies the content of structures parameter
